pipeline_name.description: Name for this pipeline configuration - useful for identification. This string will be sanitized and used in filepaths.

path.description:
Directory where C-PAC should write out processed data, logs, and crash reports.
 - If running in a container (Singularity/Docker), you can simply set this to an arbitrary name like '/outputs', and then map (-B/-v) your desired output directory to that label.
 - If running outside a container, this should be a full path to a directory.

source_outputs_dir.description:
(Optional) Path to a BIDS-Derivatives directory that already has outputs.
  - This option is intended to ingress already-existing resources from an output directory without writing new outputs back into the same directory.
  - If provided, C-PAC will ingress the already-computed outputs from this directory and continue the pipeline from where they leave off.
  - If left as 'None', C-PAC will ingress any already-computed outputs from the output directory you provide above in 'path' instead, the default behavior.

pull_source_once.description:
Set to True to make C-PAC ingress the outputs from the primary output directory if they exist, even if a source_outputs_dir is provided
  - Setting to False will pull from source_outputs_dir every time, over-writing any calculated outputs in the main output directory
  - C-PAC will still pull from source_outputs_dir if the main output directory is empty, however

write_func_outputs.description: Include extra versions and intermediate steps of functional preprocessing in the output directory.

write_debugging_outputs.description: Include extra outputs in the output directory that may be of interest when more information is needed.

output_tree.description:
Output directory format and structure.
Options: default, ndmg

generate_quality_control_images.description: Generate quality control pages containing preprocessing and derivative outputs.

generate_xcpqc_files.description: Generate eXtensible Connectivity Pipeline-style quality control files

path.description:
Directory where C-PAC should store temporary and intermediate files.
 - This directory must be saved if you wish to re-run your pipeline from where you left off (if not completed).
 - NOTE: As it stores all intermediate files, this directory can grow to become very large, especially for data with a large amount of TRs.
 - If running in a container (Singularity/Docker), you can simply set this to an arbitrary name like '/work', and then map (-B/-v) your desired output directory to that label.
 - If running outside a container, this should be a full path to a directory.
 - This can be written to '/tmp' if you do not intend to save your working directory.

remove_working_dir.description: Deletes the contents of the Working Directory after running. This saves disk space, but any additional preprocessing or analysis will have to be completely re-run.

run_logging.description: Whether to write log details of the pipeline run to the logging files.

graphviz.description: Configuration options for logging visualizations of the workflow graph

entire_workflow.description: Configuration for a graphviz visualization of the entire workflow. See https://fcp-indi.github.io/docs/developer/nodes#CPAC.pipeline.nipype_pipeline_engine.Workflow.write_graph for details about the various options

generate.description: Whether to generate the graph visualization

simple_form.description: The node name will be displayed in the form `nodename (package)` when On or `nodename.Class.package` when Off

path.description: Directory where CPAC should write crash logs.

fail_fast.description: Stop worklow execution on first crash?

random_seed.description:
Random seed used to fix the state of execution.
If unset, each process uses its own default.
If set, a `random.log` file will be generated logging the random seed and each node to which that seed was applied.
If set to a positive integer (up to 2147483647), that integer will be used to seed each process that accepts a random seed.
If set to 'random', a random positive integer (up to 2147483647) will be generated and that seed will be used to seed each process that accepts a random seed.

on_grid.description: Select Off if you intend to run CPAC on a single machine. If set to On, CPAC will attempt to submit jobs through the job scheduler / resource manager selected below.

resource_manager.description:
Sun Grid Engine (SGE), Portable Batch System (PBS), or Simple Linux Utility for Resource Management (SLURM).
Only applies if you are running on a grid or compute cluster.

parallel_environment.description:
SGE Parallel Environment to use when running CPAC.
Only applies when you are running on a grid or compute cluster using SGE.

queue.description:
SGE Queue to use when running CPAC.
Only applies when you are running on a grid or compute cluster using SGE.

maximum_memory_per_participant.description:
The maximum amount of memory each participant's workflow can allocate. Use this to place an upper bound of memory usage.
- Warning: 'Memory Per Participant' multiplied by 'Number of Participants to Run Simultaneously' must not be more than the total amount of RAM.
- Conversely, using too little RAM can impede the speed of a pipeline run.
- It is recommended that you set this to a value that when multiplied by 'Number of Participants to Run Simultaneously' is as much RAM you can safely allocate.

raise_insufficient.description:
Prior to running a pipeline C-PAC makes a rough estimate of a worst-case-scenario maximum concurrent memory usage with high-resoltion data, raising an exception describing the recommended minimum memory allocation for the given configuration.
Turning this option off will allow pipelines to run without allocating the recommended minimum, allowing for more efficient runs at the risk of out-of-memory crashes (use at your own risk)

observed_usage.description: A callback.log file from a previous run can be provided to estimate memory usage based on that run.

callback_log.description: Path to callback log file with previously observed usage. Can be overridden with the commandline flag `--runtime_usage`.

buffer.description: Percent. E.g., `buffer: 10` would estimate 1.1 * the observed memory usage from the callback log provided in "usage". Can be overridden with the commandline flag `--runtime_buffer`.

max_cores_per_participant.description:
The maximum amount of cores (on a single machine) or slots on a node (on a cluster/grid) to allocate per participant.
- Setting this above 1 will parallelize each participant's workflow where possible. If you wish to dedicate multiple cores to ANTS-based anatomical registration (below), this value must be equal or higher than the amount of cores provided to ANTS.
- The maximum number of cores your run can possibly employ will be this setting multiplied by the number of participants set to run in parallel (the 'Number of Participants to Run Simultaneously' setting).

num_ants_threads.description:
The number of cores to allocate to ANTS-based anatomical registration per participant.
- Multiple cores can greatly speed up this preprocessing step.
- This number cannot be greater than the number of cores per participant.

num_OMP_threads.description: The number of cores to allocate to processes that use OpenMP.

num_participants_at_once.description:
The number of participant workflows to run at the same time.
- The maximum number of cores your run can possibly employ will be this setting multiplied by the number of cores dedicated to each participant (the 'Maximum Number of Cores Per Participant' setting).

FSLDIR.description: Full path to the FSL version to be used by CPAC. If you have specified an FSL path in your .bashrc file, this path will be set automatically.

aws_output_bucket_credentials.description: If setting the 'Output Directory' to an S3 bucket, insert the path to your AWS credentials file here.

s3_encryption.description: Enable server-side 256-AES encryption on data to the S3 bucket

freesurfer.description: Will run Freesurfer for surface-based analysis. Will output traditional Freesurfer derivatives. If you wish to employ Freesurfer outputs for brain masking or tissue segmentation in the voxel-based pipeline, select those 'Freesurfer-' labeled options further below in anatomical_preproc.

reconall_args.description: Add extra arguments to recon-all command

post_freesurfer.description: Run ABCD-HCP post FreeSurfer and fMRISurface pipeline

longitudinal_template_generation.description: If you have multiple T1w's, you can generate your own run-specific custom T1w template to serve as an intermediate to the standard template for anatomical registration.

run.description: This runs before the main pipeline as it requires multiple T1w sessions at once.

average_method.description:
Freesurfer longitudinal template algorithm using FSL FLIRT Method to average the dataset at each iteration of the template creation
Options: median, mean or std

dof.description:
Degree of freedom for FLIRT in the template creation
Options: 12 (affine), 9 (traditional), 7 (global rescale) or 6 (rigid body)

interp.description:
Interpolation parameter for FLIRT in the template creation
Options: trilinear, nearestneighbour, sinc or spline

cost.description:
Cost function for FLIRT in the template creation
Options: corratio, mutualinfo, normmi, normcorr, leastsq, labeldiff or bbr

thread_pool.description: Number of threads used for one run of the template generation algorithm

convergence_threshold.description:
Threshold of transformation distance to consider that the loop converged
(-1 means numpy.finfo(np.float64).eps and is the default)

non_local_means_filtering.description: Non-local means filtering via ANTs DenoiseImage

n4_bias_field_correction.description: N4 bias field correction via ANTs

shrink_factor.description: An integer to resample the input image to save computation time. Shrink factors <= 4 are commonly used.

t1t2_bias_field_correction.description: Bias field correction based on square root of T1w * T2w

run_before_preproc.description: Run ACPC alignment before non-local means filtering or N4 bias correction

brain_size.description:
ACPC size of brain in z-dimension in mm.
Default: 150mm for human data.

FOV_crop.description:
Choose a tool to crop the FOV in ACPC alignment. Using FSL's robustfov or flirt command. 
Default: robustfov for human data, flirt for monkey data.

acpc_target.description:
ACPC Target
options: 'brain' or 'whole-head'
  note: 'brain' requires T1w_brain_ACPC_template below to be populated

align_brain_mask.description:
Run ACPC alignment on brain mask 
If the brain mask is in native space, turn it on
If the brain mask is ACPC aligned, turn it off

using.description:
using: ['3dSkullStrip', 'BET', 'UNet', 'niworkflows-ants', 'FreeSurfer-ABCD', 'FreeSurfer-BET-Tight', 'FreeSurfer-BET-Loose']
this is a fork option

mask_vol.description: Output a mask volume instead of a skull-stripped volume. The mask volume containes 0 to 6, which represents voxel's postion. If set to True, C-PAC will use this output to generate anatomical brain mask for further analysis.

shrink_factor.description: Set the threshold value controlling the brain vs non-brain voxels. Default is 0.6.

var_shrink_fac.description: Vary the shrink factor at every iteration of the algorithm. This prevents the likelihood of surface getting stuck in large pools of CSF before reaching the outer surface of the brain. Default is On.

shrink_factor_bot_lim.description: The shrink factor bottom limit sets the lower threshold when varying the shrink factor. Default is 0.4, for when edge detection is used (which is On by default), otherwise the default value is 0.65.

n_iterations.description: Set the number of iterations. Default is 250.The number of iterations should depend upon the density of your mesh.

pushout.description: While expanding, consider the voxels above and not only the voxels below

touchup.description: Perform touchup operations at the end to include areas not covered by surface expansion.

fill_hole.description: Give the maximum number of pixels on either side of the hole that can be filled. The default is 10 only if 'Touchup' is On - otherwise, the default is 0.

NN_smooth.description: Perform nearest neighbor coordinate interpolation every few iterations. Default is 72.

smooth_final.description: Perform final surface smoothing after all iterations. Default is 20.

avoid_eyes.description: Avoid eyes while skull stripping. Default is On.

use_edge.description: Use edge detection to reduce leakage into meninges and eyes. Default is On.

push_to_edge.description: Perform aggressive push to edge. This might cause leakage. Default is Off.

use_skull.description: Use outer skull to limit expansion of surface into the skull in case of very strong shading artifacts. Use this only if you have leakage into the skull.

perc_int.description: Percentage of segments allowed to intersect surface. It is typically a number between 0 and 0.1, but can include negative values (which implies no testing for intersection).

max_inter_iter.description: Number of iterations to remove intersection problems. With each iteration, the program automatically increases the amount of smoothing to get rid of intersections. Default is 4.

fac.description: Multiply input dataset by FAC if range of values is too small.

blur_fwhm.description: Blur dataset after spatial normalization. Recommended when you have lots of CSF in brain and when you have protruding gyri (finger like). If so, recommended value range is 2-4. Otherwise, leave at 0.

monkey.description: Set it as True if processing monkey data with AFNI

frac.description: Set the threshold value controling the brain vs non-brain voxels, default is 0.5

mask_boolean.description: Mask created along with skull stripping. It should be `On`, if selected functionalMasking :  ['Anatomical_Refined'] and `FSL` as skull-stripping method.

mesh_boolean.description: Mesh created along with skull stripping

padding.description: Add padding to the end of the image, improving BET.Mutually exclusive with functional,reduce_bias,robust,padding,remove_eyes,surfaces

reduce_bias.description: Reduce bias and cleanup neck. Mutually exclusive with functional,reduce_bias,robust,padding,remove_eyes,surfaces

remove_eyes.description: Eyes and optic nerve cleanup. Mutually exclusive with functional,reduce_bias,robust,padding,remove_eyes,surfaces

robust.description: Robust brain center estimation. Mutually exclusive with functional,reduce_bias,robust,padding,remove_eyes,surfaces

surfaces.description: Gets additional skull and scalp surfaces by running bet2 and betsurf. This is mutually exclusive with reduce_bias, robust, padding, remove_eyes

threshold.description: Apply thresholding to segmented brain image and mask

vertical_gradient.description: Vertical gradient in fractional intensity threshold (-1,1)

niworkflows-ants.description: Template to be used during niworkflows-ants. It is not necessary to change this path unless you intend to use a non-standard template.

T1w_brain_template_mask_ccs.description: Template to be used for FreeSurfer-BET brain extraction in CCS-options pipeline

run.description: Automatically segment anatomical images into white matter, gray matter, and CSF based on prior probability maps.

using.description:
using: ['FSL-FAST', 'Template_Based', 'ANTs_Prior_Based', 'FreeSurfer']
this is a fork point

use.description:
thresholding of the tissue segmentation probability maps
options: 'Auto', 'Custom'

Custom.description:
Set the threshold value for the segmentation probability masks (CSF, White Matter, and Gray Matter). The values remaining will become the binary tissue masks.
A good starting point is 0.95.

run.description: Use template-space tissue priors to refine the binary tissue masks generated by segmentation.

priors_path.description:
Full path to a directory containing binarized prior probability maps.
These maps are included as part of the 'Image Resource Files' package available on the Install page of the User Guide.
It is not necessary to change this path unless you intend to use non-standard priors.

WM_path.description:
Full path to a binarized White Matter prior probability map.
It is not necessary to change this path unless you intend to use non-standard priors.

GM_path.description:
Full path to a binarized Gray Matter prior probability map.
It is not necessary to change this path unless you intend to use non-standard priors.

CSF_path.description:
Full path to a binarized CSF prior probability map.
It is not necessary to change this path unless you intend to use non-standard priors.

template_for_segmentation.description:
These masks should be in the same space of your registration template, e.g. if you choose 'EPI Template' , below tissue masks should also be EPI template tissue masks.
Options: ['T1_Template', 'EPI_Template']

WHITE.description:
These masks are included as part of the 'Image Resource Files' package available on the Install page of the User Guide.
Full path to a binarized White Matter mask.

GRAY.description:
These masks are included as part of the 'Image Resource Files' package available on the Install page of the User Guide.
Full path to a binarized Gray Matter mask.

CSF.description:
These masks are included as part of the 'Image Resource Files' package available on the Install page of the User Guide.
Full path to a binarized CSF mask.

ANTs_Prior_Based.description: Generate white matter, gray matter, CSF masks based on antsJointLabelFusion ANTs Prior-based Segmentation workflow that has shown optimal results for non-human primate data.

template_brain_list.description: The atlas image assumed to be used in ANTs Prior-based Segmentation.

template_segmentation_list.description:
The atlas segmentation images.
For performing ANTs Prior-based segmentation method
the number of specified segmentations should be identical to the number of atlas brain image sets.
eg.
ANTs_prior_seg_template_brain_list :
  - atlas1.nii.gz
  - atlas2.nii.gz
ANTs_prior_seg_template_segmentation_list:
  - segmentation1.nii.gz
  - segmentation1.nii.gz

CSF_label.description:
Label values corresponding to CSF/GM/WM in atlas file
It is not necessary to change this values unless your CSF/GM/WM label values are different from Freesurfer Color Lookup Table.
https://surfer.nmr.mgh.harvard.edu/fswiki/FsTutorial/AnatomicalROI/FreeSurferColorLUT
Label values corresponding to CSF in multiatlas file

GM_label.description:
Label values corresponding to CSF/GM/WM in atlas file
It is not necessary to change this values unless your CSF/GM/WM label values are different from Freesurfer Color Lookup Table.
https://surfer.nmr.mgh.harvard.edu/fswiki/FsTutorial/AnatomicalROI/FreeSurferColorLUT

Label values corresponding to Gray Matter in multiatlas file

WM_label.description:
Label values corresponding to CSF/GM/WM in atlas file
It is not necessary to change this values unless your CSF/GM/WM label values are different from Freesurfer Color Lookup Table.
https://surfer.nmr.mgh.harvard.edu/fswiki/FsTutorial/AnatomicalROI/FreeSurferColorLUT

Label values corresponding to White Matter in multiatlas file

erode.description: Use mri_binarize --erode option to erode segmentation masks

CSF_label.description: Label values corresponding to CSF in FreeSurfer aseg segmentation file

GM_label.description: Label values corresponding to Gray Matter in FreeSurfer aseg segmentation file

WM_label.description: Label values corresponding to White Matter in FreeSurfer aseg segmentation file

resolution_for_anat.description: The resolution to which anatomical images should be transformed during registration. This is the resolution at which processed anatomical files will be output.

T1w_brain_template.description: Template to be used during registration. It is not necessary to change this path unless you intend to use a non-standard template.

T1w_template.description: Template to be used during registration. It is not necessary to change this path unless you intend to use a non-standard template.

T1w_brain_template_mask.description: Template to be used during registration. It is not necessary to change this path unless you intend to use a non-standard template.

reg_with_skull.description: Register skull-on anatomical image to a template.

using.description:
using: ['ANTS', 'FSL', 'FSL-linear']
this is a fork point
selecting both ['ANTS', 'FSL'] will run both and fork the pipeline

use_lesion_mask.description: If a lesion mask is available for a T1w image, use it to improve the ANTs' registration ANTS registration only.

interpolation.description:
Interpolation method for writing out transformed anatomical images.
Possible values: Linear, BSpline, LanczosWindowedSinc

fnirt_config.description: Configuration file to be used by FSL to set FNIRT parameters. It is not necessary to change this path unless you intend to use custom FNIRT parameters or a non-standard template.

ref_resolution.description:
The resolution to which anatomical images should be transformed during registration.
This is the resolution at which processed anatomical files will be output. 
specifically for monkey pipeline

FNIRT_T1w_brain_template.description:
Template to be used during registration.
It is for monkey pipeline specifically.

FNIRT_T1w_template.description:
Template to be used during registration.
It is for monkey pipeline specifically.

interpolation.description:
Interpolation method for writing out transformed anatomical images.
Possible values: trilinear, sinc, spline

identity_matrix.description:
Identity matrix used during FSL-based resampling of anatomical-space data throughout the pipeline.
It is not necessary to change this path unless you intend to use a different template.

ref_mask_res-2.description: Reference mask with 2mm resolution to be used during FNIRT-based brain extraction in ABCD-options pipeline.

T1w_template_res-2.description: Template with 2mm resolution to be used during FNIRT-based brain extraction in ABCD-options pipeline.

using.description:
Choose the tool to overwrite transform, currently only support 'FSL' to overwrite 'ANTs' transforms in ABCD-options pipeline.
using: 'FSL'

reference.description:
reference: 'brain' or 'restore-brain'
In ABCD-options pipeline, 'restore-brain' is used as coregistration reference

using.description: Choose FSL or ABCD as coregistration method

input.description: Choose brain or whole-head as coregistration input

reg_with_skull.description: Choose whether to use functional brain or skull as the input to functional-to-anatomical registration

input.description:
Choose whether to use the mean of the functional/EPI as the input to functional-to-anatomical registration or one of the volumes from the functional 4D timeseries that you choose.
input: ['Mean_Functional', 'Selected_Functional_Volume', 'fmriprep_reference']

n4_correct_func.description:
Run ANTs' N4 Bias Field Correction on the input BOLD (EPI)
this can increase tissue contrast which may improve registration quality in some data

func_reg_input_volume.description:
Only for when 'Use as Functional-to-Anatomical Registration Input' is set to 'Selected Functional Volume'.
Input the index of which volume from the functional 4D timeseries input file you wish to use as the input for functional-to-anatomical registration.
